markdownRemark.html: Since attending Aaron Turner's presentation at the 2020 PerfMatters Conference, I'd been wanting to try WebAssembly. And why not use the opportunity to also learn another language like Go with the right concurrency primitives? After following all the golang tutorials, I dove into the docs for compiling Go to WebAssembly to make it executable in a browser environment. This is the result so far, but I'm hoping to add more functionality in the coming months.

frontmatter.title: Dipping a Toe in Go and WebAssembly
